Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.2: WEATHER OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique observation number for a weather orconditions reading. May be used to indicate ocean conditions, weather conditions etc.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.6: HEAVE: The oscillatory vertical rise and fall, due to the entire hull being lifted by theforce of the sea. Also called HEAVING. See also SHIPMOTIONS.(www.chron.com/content/interactive/voyager/sail/glossary)
Column Comment.7: PITCH: A fore and aft rocking motion of a boat.(www.chron.com/content/interactive/voyager/sail/glossary)
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: RECORDED TIME: The time at which this condition was recorded.
Column Comment.10: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.12: REFERENCE ROAD CONDITION: a valid list of road conditions. Road conditionsprovide important environmental, safety and billing information. A sample list ofvalues may be found athttp://www.highways.gov.sk.ca/docs/travelers_info/road_terminology.asp
Column Comment.13: ROLL: A side-to-side motion of the boat, usually caused by waves.(www.chron.com/content/interactive/voyager/sail/glossary)
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: SWELL HEIGHT: Hieght of Large smooth waves that do not break. Swells areformed by wind action over a long distance.(www.chron.com/content/interactive/voyager/sail/glossary)
Column Comment.16: TEMPERATURE: the temperature reading taken with the weather observation.
Column Comment.18: WATER CONDITION TYPE: A list of valid conditions of a large water body, such asan ocean, sea, gulf or lake. Could include values such as choppy, high swell, rough.
Column Comment.19: WAVE HEIGHT: The height of the waves, on top of the swell.
Column Comment.20: WEATHER CONDITION TYPE: Valid kinds of weather conditions such as sunny andcalm, rain showers, snow, ice fog etc.
Column Comment.21: WIND DIRECTION: The direction the wind is coming from.
Column Comment.22: WIND STRENGTH: The strength of the wind, often measured according to astandard list of wind strengths, such as the Beaufort Wind Scale(www.bom.gov.au/lam/glossary/beaufort.shtml)
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
